intro: Porophyllum ochroleucum, commonly known as the whiteleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-gray, woolly leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in areas with poor soil and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Porophyllum ochroleucum is also known for its medicinal uses by some indigenous communities.
